profile.name: Feross Aboukhadijeh
profile.bio:
• Founder + CEO of Socket (@SocketDev) 
• Started @webtorrent and @standard 
• 100+ open source packages on npm
• Stanford lecturer for Web Security

analysis.career_trajectory: Started with JavaScript in 2023, focusing on various utility libraries and tools such as run-series, speakeasyjs.com, simple-get, git-pull-or-clone, safe-buffer, thanks, simple-sha256, yt-player, drag-drop, hyperscript-attribute-to-property, queue-microtask, TheAnnoyingSite.com, chrome-dgram, chrome-net, timidity, cross-zip, arch, express-sitemap-xml, simple-peer, connectivity, bitmidi.com, Signal-Desktop, hostile, base64-js, feross.org, buffer, dotfiles, prezto. Pivoted to TypeScript in 2024 for Signal-Desktop and continued with JavaScript for other projects. Continued to explore various libraries and tools, including WebRTC, MIDI, and Node.js utilities.

comment_analytics.communication_style: Asks deep architectural questions, Nitpicks code style, Supportive mentor.

match_profile.similar_user_traits: A developer who is detail-oriented and enjoys exploring various libraries and tools.
conversation_starters: What are some common pitfalls when implementing WebRTC in a Node.js application?
How do you approach debugging complex issues with JavaScript utilities?
Can you share your experience with TypeScript for desktop applications?
